contentrichtext.text: [[File:Chichibu_ryusei_Fes_1.jpg|thumb|Ryusei Festival in Yoshida]] {{Nihongo|'''Yoshida'''|吉田町|Yoshida-machi}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] in [[Chichibu District, Saitama]], Japan. In 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 5,728 and a [[population density]] of 86.66 persons per km². The total area was 66.10 km². On April 1, 2005 Yoshida, along with the villages of [[Arakawa, Saitama|Arakawa]] and [[Ōtaki, Saitama|Ōtaki]], all from [[Chichibu District, Saitama|Chichibu District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Chichibu, Saitama|Chichibu]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipality of Japan|municipality]]. ==External links== * [http://www.city.chichibu.saitama.jp/ Chichibu official website] {{ja icon}} {{Saitama-geo-stub}} {{coord|36.033|N|139.033|E|region:JP_type:city_source:GNS-enwiki|display=title}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Saitama Prefecture]] [[Category:Chichibu District, Saitama]]
